document_name: http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/UKR/Project Document_Democratization and Human Rights Programme in Ukraine.pdf

outputs.output_descr: Capacities of CSOs and HR actors' strengthened to promote democracy, defend human rights and to foster participatory and results-driven Government-CSO dialogue.

Capacities of civil society organizations strengthened to promote democracy.  Wider and results-driven Government-CSO dialogue advocated through regional and national mechanisms; implementation of the Law on Public Associations monitored.

Two types of actors are to be supported: the mid-size regional human rights CSOs whose capacities will be developed though individually tailored capacity development programme;  a separate capacity development exercise will be pursued with the Office of the Ombudsperson (OO) to: (a) increase the general organizational capacity of this institution in terms of monitoring and addressing human rights violations, (b) strengthen cooperation between the OO and the civil society, (c) production and submission of monitoring report to UN and EU monitoring mechanisms and (d) foster access to and linkages with international human rights networks.
The programme will target its efforts on enhancing local-level fiscal transparency at the municipal level attempting to address the gap created by the lack of access to municipal budgeting data.
Sustainable operation of National Gender Machinery will be advocated through targeted support to the Ministry of Social Policy of Ukraine and to the Office of Ombudsperson in Ukraine.

project_descr: Democratization and Human Rights Programme in Ukraine
project_title: Democratization and Human Rights Programme in Ukraine
